Hi Simon, you asked for ideas on where new features could be suitable. I
th=
ink theories would emphasize the global applicability of some rules like:
s=
ymmetry of equality, an object should always equal itself etc. Two examples=

to illustrate:

@Theory equalsIsSymetrical(BinaryDigit bd1, BinaryDigit bd=
2) {
    assertEquals(bd1.equals(bd2), bd2.equals(bd1));
}

@Theory anInsta=
nceAlwaysEqualsItself(BinaryDigit bd) {
    assertTrue(bd.equals(bd));
}

I=
 think it shows more clearly that this is true for any instance of
BinaryDi=
git and not just the ones used to show the same thing in a normal
@Test ann=
otated test.

For this to work you have to add the @RunWith(Theories.class)=
 annotaion and
annotate the BinaryDigit instances as DataPoints.

Thanks fo=
r posting this code.
